title: Want to Delete Your Twitter DMs? Good Luck With That

last_post.content:
I know there is a lot going on at Twitter right now, but here's one more thing. Twitter is ignoring #GDPR requests from people to delete their DMs.

At the moment, when you press delete on a Twitter DM (an individual message or conversation) the DM isn't actually deleted from Twitter's servers, just your inbox view.

So people in Europe have been making requests for Twitter to blitz all their messages. It hasn't properly answered them. And now regulators are looking at it

Full story here: https://www.wired.com/story/delete-twitter-dms-gdpr/

#Twitter #gdpr #infosec #technology #news #wired

title: Moving or leaving accounts - Mastodon documentation

last_post.content:
If you want to migrate your account to .art, go to https://mastodon.art and click 'create account' on the right. Go through the process, the button at the end says 'get on waitlist' - that puts you in an application queue that we check and approve regularly.

When your account has been accepted, you can find instructions on migrating your account here:

https://docs.joinmastodon.org/user/moving/

Your follows and followers should automatically come with you, but posts won't.

With the upcoming v1.0.0 of https://thi.ng/color-palettes, this set of currently 210 color themes (each consisting of 6 colors extracted from images via k-means clustering, then hand-tweaked) is not just a "dumb" collection anymore, but can be used as database to be queried to select matching themes via algorithmic means, in the form of composable parametric filter functions. A bunch of useful filters are provided, and custom ones can be easily implemented too. Open for ideas to add more. Additionally, themes can also be obtained in multiple formats now, incl. CSS hex strings, LCH/sRGB vectors (e.g. for WebGL/WebGPU). Release later today.
